title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 123.5 - Implementation
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 123.5 - Implementation

State Regulations

Public schools shall prohibit school officers and employees
when located on school property or at a school function from utilizing or
promoting any Indigenous name, logo, or mascot. This provision shall not apply
to any school officer or employee who is a member of a tribal nation and is
utilizing or promoting an Indigenous name, logo, or mascot of such tribal
nation. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
123.5

Adopted

New

York State Register May 3, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 18, eff. 5/3/2023

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
